alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 23 at 7:28PM PST until December 28 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM MONDAY TO 10 PM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 22 to 28 feet. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast; which includes the Curry, Coos, and Douglas County coast. * WHEN...Monday to at least Thursday. * IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will create hazardous conditions along and within the surf zone, and could inundate beaches and low lying shorelines. Beach erosion is possible, and exposed infrastructure may be damaged. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - King tides will be occuring December 24th through the 27th. This will increase the height of breaking waves and increase the wave`s ability to cause beach erosion. - The largest breaking waves are expected to occur from Tuesday night into Wednesday afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Stay away from the surf zone and off of jetties. Area beaches may become hazardous due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
